Text: Okay...time for Plan B.

I purposely say it out loud. These kind of words
sound cooler that way.
Plan B? What's that?
Heh... You're about to find out. Wait, no, maybe notâ€”

This whole thing is already part of Plan B.
I'm about to tie it all together.

The nobody who sits in the back corner of the
classroom by the window is always the one who
misunderstands glory or sudden fortune.

They think they're unique or special, the chosen one.
They say cringey things.

But reality is a cruel mistress. They realize the
truth over time.

There isn't anything special about them. They return
to the path, and become another cog in the wheel
of society.

So their period of edgy-ness ends, and later on they
cringe at their own words and actions...!

From now on, their life replays in fast forward, and
makes everyone around them think they're some
kind of edgelord!
Plan B. I call it "End of Edgy-ness".

Um... Just because you did something kind of, er,
I guess pretty awesome, don't let it go to your head.

Yeah, I didn't even know I could move like that.
It's a good thing I always simulated it in my head.

Did you really think about a terrorist taking over
the school...?

You guys haven't? Like, what you would do if it
happened?

I'm trying to come off as someone lost in
fantasyland, so I dig deeper.

Well, I really had thought about it though.
That's why I got really excited when it
actually happened.

Well, guess I can't say that I haven't, but more
along the lines of how to run away and alert
the authorities.

S-Sure? Maybe if my own class was attacked we'd be
able to get away...? But, I'd leave the force to the
authorities...

(They know their places even in a fantasy... I knew
they were the perfect side characters.)

(I want to admire their natural obliviousness from
the bottom of my heart, but that would get in the
way of Plan B.)

(I'll surpass that and show you what being a true
extra is all about!)

No way. You gotta be the strongest in your fantasies.
Like you have a secret power!

Like me, I've got a secret power that might awaken
itself at any moment!

If even in a dream, I want to be strong. A real side
character would think that.

Make sure to fantasize about it! That way, you can
be sure to stand out the next time something
happens...

So when that fantasy becomes a reality, you can be
like me and have the courage to do something!

(Turn away from reality, and dream a dream that'll
never come true. Become a true side character!)
I dunno if you're giving us advice or bragging.
At least we know he's full of himself.

(Good, good. They're giving me the evil eye. I can
tell they're fed up with me.)

(They can see me getting stuck-up, and when I reach
the top, all that's left is to go down.)

It seems like you guys are doubting my true
power. Looks like you need convincing.

The hidden power I have is real. Want me to do
something?
(Here, I need to give solid proof.)

(The hidden power I have is real. I need to make a
big deal of it, and then fail.)

(Of course, I've already thought up several plans to
fail and how to do so.)

(By failing the task they give me, it will give them
an even stronger impression.)

Right...if you say so. I challenge you to the
semester finals!

Since summer break was pushed up, the scope of the
test is narrow. Even we can do well...you think you
can do better?
Interesting...you're on!

(I thought they were gonna challenge me to something
physical, that was unexpected.)

(But it's perfect. You two better keep your eyes
open, or you'll miss my perfect NPC Technique!)
That night, I stayed up until dawn preparing...
The next day, the morning of the finals.
Mornin', did you study hard...hmm?!
Hehe, hehehe...

Hey, those bags under your eyes... D-Did you stay up
all night studying?!

Nope, didn't study a thing. Not at all.
This's gonna suckâ€”

(First, I need to play up that I didn't study. The
bags under my eyes saying I pulled an all-
nighter are a bonus!)

(Trying to hide the fact that you put a ton of
effort in...how's that for side character
reallness!)

Hehe, trying to catch us off guard, huh?
Not today, Cid!
Just wait and see, we have our own secret plan...
Oh yeah? Bring it on. See ya later.

I sit down at my desk and pull out the small study
cards I made, pretending to prepare for second
period geography and history class as I flip
through them.

It's the last, vain struggle before the test begins.
There's no one else who can perfect the side
character style better than I can.
Everyone, be seated. The test is about to begin.

And so, the preliminary battle of Plan B,
the semester final, has begun.

(Honestly, even if I don't have a plan I understand
most of what's on the test. With  practice and
memorization, anyone could probably get all
the answers right.)

(Especially third period math, it's probably
a breeze.)

(Use up all the time we get, fill out all the answers,
and get everything wrong... Not a bad idea, but...)

(That would make it seem on purpose... I'll get a
few right, then get everything else wrong.)

I pull out the pencil dice that I spent all night
making.

I took a hexagonal pencil and chiseled down the end,
then put in a numbered die.

It's my secret weapon that I'll use to answer
the test. Perfect for an extra.
(Go, pencil dice...!)

(Hmm... The answers are spread out nicely.
At this rate, I should get about 20 points...)
You! What are you doing!
(Urk, did the teacher notice?!)

I was startled by the sudden loud voice, but it
wasn't aimed at me. The teacher was looking
at...
Uh, no, this, um...

You have a cheat sheet on the inside of your pencil
case... And the two of you have the exact same
answers.
It's not like that! It's...it's just a coincidence!

Then tell me how you both have, word for word, the
same answer about the author?! Cheating AND
passing answers! You both fail, see you again
next semester!
B-But...!!

What are those two fools doing... But, hm...I should
have made a cheat sheat!

Even if I purposely got a low score, Skel and Po's
cheating overshadowed that and my repuation didn't
take much of a hit...
